definitions.definition: Used after a pause for thought to introduce a new topic , question or story , or a new thought or question in continuation of an existing topic.
examples: So , there was this squirrel stuck in the chimney...
So , everyone wants to know – did you win the contest or not?

definitions.definition: Used as a question to ask for further explanation of something said, often rhetorically or in a dismissive or impolite manner .
examples: "You park your car in front of my house every morning." — " So ?"

definitions.definition: Used as a meaningless filler word to begin a response to a question.
examples: What are you doing? / So I'm just fixing this shelf.
What time does the train leave? / So it leaves at 10 o'clock.

definitions.definition: Be as you are; stand still; used especially to cows; also used by sailors.

main_definition: Used after a pause for thought to introduce a new topic , question or story , or a new thought or question in continuation of an existing topic.
secondary_definitions: Used as a question to ask for further explanation of something said, often rhetorically or in a dismissive or impolite manner .
Used as a meaningless filler word to begin a response to a question.
( archaic ) Be as you are; stand still; used especially to cows; also used by sailors.
